text: Perfect numbers like perfect men are very rare.
author: Rene Descartes

text: The tragedy of life is in what dies inside a man while he lives - the death of genuine feeling, the death of inspired response, the awareness that makes it possible to feel the pain or the glory of other men in yourself.
author: Norman Cousins

text: To send light into the darkness of men's hearts - such is the duty of the artist.
author: Robert Schumann

text: Advertising is a business of words, but advertising agencies are infested with men and women who cannot write. They cannot write advertisements, and they cannot write plans. They are helpless as deaf mutes on the stage of the Metropolitan Opera.
author: David Ogilvy

text: I dress for the image. Not for myself, not for the public, not for fashion, not for men.
author: Marlene Dietrich
